Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Source: Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Propaganda)[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Propaganda is information that is not objective and is used primarily to influence an audience and further an agenda, often by presenting facts selectively to encourage a particular synthesis or perception, or using loaded language to produce an emotional rather than a rational response to the information that is presented. Propaganda is often associated with material prepared by governments, but activist groups, companies and the media can also produce propaganda.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Propaganda[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from Ideology pressure by 50%.

Propaganda is often associated with material prepared by governments, but activist groups, companies and the media can also produce propaganda.
